family: The town of Twin Peaks itself
text: Twin Peaks is an American television serial drama created by Mark Frost and David Lynch. The series initially follows the investigation – headed by FBI Special Agent Dale Cooper (Kyle MacLachlan) – of the brutal murder of a popular teenager and homecoming queen, Laura Palmer (Sheryl Lee).

children.name: Sheryl Lee
children.text: Hey, what's up, doc? Its Laura, in case you haven't guessed.

children.name: Ray Wise
children.text: We have to dance – for Laura!

children.name: Grace Zabriskie
children.text: Laura honey, are you downstairs?

children.name: Sheryl Lee
children.text: You looked at me and you saw Laura. Wanna know something kind of strange? I liked it.

children.name: Richard Beymer
children.text: How many times have I asked you not to disturb the guests with this racket?

children.name: David Patrick Kelly
children.text: Next step: rocket science!

children.name: Sherilyn Fenn
children.text: Well maybe I could go with you.

children.name: Jan D'Arcy
children.text: You can tell Johnny once again that Laura won’t come this afternoon to work with him.

children.name: Thor Odinson
children.text: Amen... Amen!

children.name: John Boylan
children.text: Is this thing on?

children.name: Tony Jay
children.text: I do.

children.name: Robyn Lively
children.text: I want to win the Miss Twin Peaks contest.

children.name: Billy Zane
children.text: I guess a simple goodbye was out of the question.

children.name: Ian Buchanan
children.text: Capital, Mr. Horne. I'll alert my attorney.

children.name: Piper Laurie
children.text: I just thought you ought to know what your sentimental good-will shenanigans cost us yesterday. You do know what shenanigans are, don’t you?

children.name: Jack Nance
children.text: Fellas, don't drink that coffee! You're not gonna believe this, there was a fish in the percolator!

children.name: Joan Chen
children.text: I won't leave this office without my money!

children.name: David Warner
children.text: I don't believe in ghosts.

children.name: Mak Takano
children.text: I don't believe in ghosts.

children.name: Dan O'Herlihy
children.text: Pity. It's an appealing notion. The return of the grisly phantom from the grave. You deserve haunting, to be sure. Look closer, Thomas. I'm alive!

children.name: James Marshall
children.text: It's not really a place its a feeling. Sometimes riding at night, I punch off the headlights and roll the throttle in just rocket blind into the dark.

children.name: Everett McGill
children.text: It’s not the first time, it won’t be the last, but I’m in that doghouse again.

children.name: Wendy Robie
children.text: Ed, are you waiting for those drapes to hang themselves?

children.name: Gary Hershberger
children.text: Donna, you get to the sheriff's right now.

children.name: Don S. Davis
children.text: I’m not at liberty to divulge that information.

children.name: Dana Ashbrook
children.text: Norma, I'll see you in my dreams.

children.name: Charlotte Stewart
children.text: We’re here for you, Bobby.

children.name: Peggy Lipton
children.text: Maybe, that’s our problem, Ed. We never want to hurt anyone. We never just take what we want.

children.name: Catherine E. Coulson
children.text: One day my log will have something to say about this. My log saw something that night.

children.name: Chris Mulkey
children.text: I told you to mind the store, Leo, not open your own franchise!

children.name: Heather Graham
children.text: Listen to me, I've been out of circulation for so long I've completely forgotten social niceties. You asked me how I am, I'm not really supposed to say how I am, I'm supposed to say "I'm fime thanks, how are you"

children.name: Jane Greer
children.text: From whatever fowl did you get these eggs?

children.name: Michael Ontkean
children.text: Good. Because normaly if a stranger walked into my police station talking that kind of insulting crap, he'd be looking for his front teeth two blocks away on Queer Street!

children.name: Ray Wise
children.text: Sheriff, I’m going to transfer it to the phone on the table by the red chair. The red chair against the wall. The little table with lamp on it. The lamp we moved from the corner? The black phone, not the brown phone.

children.name: Kyle MacLachlan
children.text: You know, this is – excuse me – a damn fine cup of coffee.

children.name: Harry Goaz
children.text: Tell Harry… I didn’t cry. But Lucy, it’s so horrible.

children.name: Michael Horse
children.text: One woman can make you fly like an eagle, another can give you the strength of a lion, but only one in the cycle of life can fill your heart with wonder and the wisdom that you have known a singular joy. I wrote that for my girlfriend.

children.name: Miguel Ferrer
children.text: Oh yeah, well I've had about enough of morons and half wits, dolts, dunces, dullards and dumbbells ... and you, you chowder-head yokel, you blithering hayseed — you've had enough of me?

children.name: David Lynch
children.text: Take another look sonny, it's gonna happen again!

children.name: David Duchovny
children.text: Coop, I may be wearing a dress, but I still pull my panties on one leg at a time if you know what I mean.

children.name: Tony Burton
children.text: Garland Briggs is the best pilot I've ever known. He was born with hardware most of us only dream of having. He's been walking point on this operation for three years, carrying a full pack. I'll tell you this: his disappearance has implications that go so far beyond national security the cold war seems like a case of the sniffles.

children.name: Frances Bay
children.text: I requested no creamed corn! Do you see creamed corn on that plate?

children.name: Austin Jack Lynch
children.text: J'ai une ame solitaire

children.name: Lenny von Dohlen
children.text: There are things you can't get anywhere... but we dream they can be found in other people.

children.name: Phoebe Augustine
children.text: Train! Train!

children.name: Victoria Catlin
children.text: When you work for me, everybody's your type.

children.name: Jacques Ferrière
children.text: Bite the bullet, baby! Bite the bullet!

children.name: Clay Wilcox
children.text: Jacques don't pay me anything. I'm no mule!

children.name: Michael Parks
children.text: Before you came here, Twin Peaks was a simple place. My brothers sold drugs to truck-drivers and teenagers. One-Eyed Jack's welcomed curious tourists and businessmen. Quiet people lived quiet lives. Then a pretty girl dies. And you arrive. Everything changes. My brother Bernard is shot and left to die in the woods. A grieving father smothers my surviving brother with a pillow. Arson, kidnapping. More death and destruction. Suddenly the quiet people here are no longer quiet. Their simple dreams have become a nightmare. Maybe you brought the nightmare with you. And maybe, it will die with you.

children.name: unidentified Myna Bird
children.text: Lora, Lora..., don't go there, Leo no!

children.name: Frank Silva
children.text: Mike. Mike! Can you hear me? Catch you... with my death bag! You may think I've gone insane... but I promise. I will kill again.

children.name: Al Strobel
children.text: He is BOB, eager for fun. He wears a smile, everybody run.

children.name: Michael J. Anderson
children.text: Let's rock!

children.name: Kenneth Welsh
children.text: Your silence speaks volumes, or if not volumes, at least the occasional unpunctuated paragraph.

children.name: Carel Struycken
children.text: Think of me as a friend.

children.name: Hank Worden
children.text: Warm milk.

children.name: Russ Tamblyn
children.text: The problems of our entire society are of a sexual nature.

children.name: Eric Da Re
children.text: So? I paid my debt to society.

children.name: Mädchen Amick
children.text: I’m a waitress in a diner. I’ve never been compared to a goddess before.

children.name: Annette McCarthy
children.text: :I can almost hear what's inside from here... Live nearby?

children.name: Nicholas Love
children.text: Once a fortnight
